header: Cri.Bail Appln. No. 11/2019 1 Nana Bhale IN THE COURT OF SESSIONS JUDGE, BARAMATI. (Presided over by S.T.Bhalerao, Addl.Sessions Judge) Criminal Bail Application No. : 11 of 2019 . (CNR NO. : MHPU14­000050­2019) Applicant : Nana Bhagwat Bhale // VERSUS // Non­applicant : 1] State of Maharashtra Through Police Station Officer, Police Station Indapur, District Pune.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXHIBIT 1. ( Passed on this 17th January, 2019 ) This is second application for grant of bail in Crime No. 613/2018 under Sections 307, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148, 149 of the Indian Penal Code registered at Police Station Indapur, Dist. Pune filed under Section 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.

under section 439 of the code of criminal procedure

arguments.text: 2] It is contended that applicant was not present on the spot of incident. On suspicion the informant made him as an accused. The recovery is completed. The other co accused are already released on bail, hence, the ground of parity is available to the applicant. Section 307 of IPC is not attracted against him. He is permanent resident of village Khorochi and having landed and household property. He is ready to abide by the conditions, if any, imposed by the Court. The custodial interrogation is not required. It is prayed to allow the application.

argumentSentences.text: 2] It is contended that applicant was not present on the spot of incident.
On suspicion the informant made him as an accused.
The recovery is completed.
The other co accused are already released on bail, hence, the ground of parity is available to the applicant.
Section 307 of IPC is not attracted against him.
He is permanent resident of village Khorochi and having landed and household property.
He is ready to abide by the conditions, if any, imposed by the Court.
The custodial interrogation is not required.
It is prayed to allow the application.

arguments.text: 3] The Investigation Officer and the learned A.P.P. opposed the Cri.Bail Appln. No. 11/2019 2 Nana Bhale application by filing say at exh.5. It is submitted that the accused and others assaulted the informant. This accused also assaulted the informant with a sword on his head and caused a bleeding injury. The informant fell down and then the accused persons fled the spot. There are eye witnesses of the incident. The sword and other weapons came to be seized. The offence is serious and the accused and others attempted to kill the informant. One of the accused is yet to be arrested. If released, the accused could pressurize the witnesses. The investigation is incomplete. Hence, the application for bail be rejected.

It is submitted that the accused and others assaulted the informant.

If released, the accused could pressurize the witnesses.
The investigation is incomplete.
Hence, the application for bail be rejected.

arguments.text: 4] Heard both the sides and perused the copy of case diary produced for perusal. The learned Advocate for the accused submitted that other accused have been granted bail. This accused is in the custody for two months from 12th November 2018. He is ready to abide the conditions. The informant has given no objection to allow the bail.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Heard both the sides and perused the copy of case diary produced for perusal.
The learned Advocate for the accused submitted that other accused have been granted bail.
This accused is in the custody for two months from 12th November 2018.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
The informant has given no objection to allow the bail.

arguments.text: 5] The learned A.P.P. submitted that the offence is serious. This is the main accused who assaulted the informant with a sword. The investigation is incomplete. Hence, it is submitted to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 5] The learned A.P.P. submitted that the offence is serious.
This is the main accused who assaulted the informant with a sword.
The investigation is incomplete.
Hence, it is submitted to reject the application.

arguments.text: 6] On perusal of the copy of case diary, it reveals that the name of the accused is there in the report so also, the role has been mentioned. This accused is stated having inflicted kicks and fists blows to the informant. Not only this, he again chased the informant and dealt a blow of sword on his head. There are statements against this accused. The role of this accused appears to be most serious among the accused persons.

argumentSentences.text: 6] On perusal of the copy of case diary, it reveals that the name of the accused is there in the report so also, the role has been mentioned.
This accused is stated having inflicted kicks and fists blows to the informant.
Not only this, he again chased the informant and dealt a blow of sword on his head.
There are statements against this accused.
The role of this accused appears to be most serious among the accused persons.

arguments.text: 7] As observed in earlier application (Cri. Bail application no. 865/2018) on 13/11/2018, there is prima facie strong material against the grave role of this accused. Inflicting of a sword blow and causing injury is not alleged having been done by other accused. Thus, this accused cannot claim parity, though he is in custody for two months. The investigation is still incomplete. The investigation is incomplete. There are no such changes in the circumstances, to allow the successive bail application.

arguments.text: 8] Considering the gravity of the role of this accused and seriousness of the offence, at this stage he is not entitled to be released on bail. Hence, the following order.

processedText:
Cri.Bail Appln. No. 11/2019 1 Nana Bhale IN THE COURT OF SESSIONS JUDGE, BARAMATI. (Presided over by S.T.Bhalerao, Addl.Sessions Judge) Criminal Bail Application No. : 11 of 2019 . (CNR NO. : MHPU14­000050­2019) Applicant : Nana Bhagwat Bhale // VERSUS // Non­applicant : 1] State of Maharashtra Through Police Station Officer, Police Station Indapur, District Pune. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXHIBIT 1. ( Passed on this 17th January, 2019 ) This is second application for grant of bail in Crime No. 613/2018 under Sections 307, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148, 149 of the Indian Penal Code registered at Police Station Indapur, Dist. Pune filed under Section 439 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. 
---background-ends---
2] It is contended that applicant was not present on the spot of incident. On suspicion the informant made him as an accused. The recovery is completed. The other co accused are already released on bail, hence, the ground of parity is available to the applicant. Section 307 of IPC is not attracted against him. He is permanent resident of village Khorochi and having landed and household property. He is ready to abide by the conditions, if any, imposed by the Court. The custodial interrogation is not required. It is prayed to allow the application. 
---argument-ends---
3] The Investigation Officer and the learned A.P.P. opposed the Cri.Bail Appln. No. 11/2019 2 Nana Bhale application by filing say at exh.5. It is submitted that the accused and others assaulted the informant. This accused also assaulted the informant with a sword on his head and caused a bleeding injury. The informant fell down and then the accused persons fled the spot. There are eye witnesses of the incident. The sword and other weapons came to be seized. The offence is serious and the accused and others attempted to kill the informant. One of the accused is yet to be arrested. If released, the accused could pressurize the witnesses. The investigation is incomplete. Hence, the application for bail be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
4] Heard both the sides and perused the copy of case diary produced for perusal. The learned Advocate for the accused submitted that other accused have been granted bail. This accused is in the custody for two months from 12th November 2018. He is ready to abide the conditions. The informant has given no objection to allow the bail. 
---argument-ends---
5] The learned A.P.P. submitted that the offence is serious. This is the main accused who assaulted the informant with a sword. The investigation is incomplete. Hence, it is submitted to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
6] On perusal of the copy of case diary, it reveals that the name of the accused is there in the report so also, the role has been mentioned. This accused is stated having inflicted kicks and fists blows to the informant. Not only this, he again chased the informant and dealt a blow of sword on his head. There are statements against this accused. The role of this accused appears to be most serious among the accused persons. 
---argument-ends---
7] As observed in earlier application (Cri. Bail application no. 865/2018) on 13/11/2018, there is prima facie strong material against the grave role of this accused. Inflicting of a sword blow and causing injury is not alleged having been done by other accused. Thus, this accused cannot claim parity, though he is in custody for two months. The investigation is still incomplete. The investigation is incomplete. There are no such changes in the circumstances, to allow the successive bail application. 
---argument-ends---
8] Considering the gravity of the role of this accused and seriousness of the offence, at this stage he is not entitled to be released on bail. Hence, the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER The application (Exh.1) is rejected. 
---order-ends---
Baramati. ( S.T. Bhalerao ) Dated : 17.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Baramati.
